riceyCodes_O.text_s: Object terminator, indicates no more items in the object in bsonish lists
Generic signed int64, use depends on context.
Generic signed int32, use depends on context.
Generic MPZ large integer, use depends on context.
Generic MPQ large integer fraction, use depends on context.
Identifies an algorithm type for hash or crypto key, or other types depending on context
Generic string, use depends on context, for instance in an image object this would be the alt text
Generic data block, use determined by the object which contains it.
A Chain Block always contains a signedBlock_O which includes a time_i, and a signature_O.
A Signed Block in the chain always contains a parentSignature_O a time_i of when the block was signed, the signature_O is found in the object which contains the signedBlock_O.
Contains a copy of the signature_O of one or more (more in the case of merging forked chains) parent blocks.

Hash object, only found in chainBlock_O and similar objects which contain a signedBlock_O, contains an algorithm id (type_y) and the hash by that algorithm of the binary representation of the objects in the signedBlock_O (data_b) and a timestamp (time_i) matching the time_i in the signedBlock_O and which must not be as old or older than any parent timestamp and also should not be in the future, these time_i are unique identifiers for chainBlock_O objects.
UTC time of block creation (microseconds since epoch x 189).  May never be less than or equal to the timei of any parent block.  Serves as a unique id for AOBO blocks.
A quantity of shares - meaning depends on context
algorithm ID (algor) for SHA2 - 256
algorithm ID (algor) for Elliptic Curve ECDSA curve BrainpoolP256r1
algorithm ID (algor) for 3072 bit RSA - less commonly used algorithms get longer ricey codes
algorithm ID (algor) for SHA3 - 512
Found in image objects, tells what format the data_b is to be interpreted as
Found in image objects, tells what format the data_b is to be interpreted as
Test protocol symbol: TⒶ2021.9.7
Test protocol symbol: TⒶ2021.10.13
Live protocol symbol: Ⓐ2021.12.15
An Assign Onward Protocol identifier
An Assign Onward Genesis Block. With a zzz0 which includes a timei, and other definitions for the chain.
Chain Description, generally only found in the Genesis Block - descriptive items like name, symbol, number of coins represented by all shares, etc.

Chain Functional items description, generally only found in the Genesis Block - functional items like Protocol ID, creation time, founder's public key, number of shares, expiration rates, recording fees, etc.

Used when reporting the last blocks in a chain, this block is a signal that all known blocks are received.  Has a pzzzO and zzzO and timei of when it was reported, but contains no transaction information and will (usually) be discarded when appending new transaction blocks to its parent.
A short string like ITC representing the chain.
A longer string like Itcoin representing the chain.
A brief sentence like "The greatest blockchain ever" describing the chain.
A paragraph (say 1000-ish characters) describing the chain.
A square-ish image that looks good small, representing the chain.
A wide image that might be displayed near the top of a page, representing the chain.
A more detailed image representing the chain.
The number of shares recorded in the Genesis block.
The number of "coins" all the shares in this chain represent.
The number of coins per byte charged to record data on this chain (usually 1/a very large number).
